DataElement.preferredName: SF-36v2 Health Survey Now Comparison One Year Ago Health Status Now Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of a comparison of their current general health between one year ago and now, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard US Version 2.0 Questionnaire Generalized Health Status Now Comparison One Year Ago Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized, multipurpose, general health survey developed by John E. Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses._Widespread, broadly dispersed, common._The state of a subject's mental or physical condition._At the present time._The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences._The time period one year before the current time._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Likert scale used for comparing a condition where 1 is much better and 5 is much worse now than one year ago.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Much worse now than one year ago

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Much worse now than one year ago
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.: At the present time.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: The time period one year before the current time.: Showing many obvious signs of deterioration or decline.
